H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H5823.def: = causative action by which humans loosen the ground with a mattock

H5619.def: = causative action by which humans throw stones at other humans

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2672.def: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

H3342.def: = large container; ◄ normally hewn out of stone and part of a winepress; ► where the grape juice is collected

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H891.def: = undesirable plant product, probably bad-smelling and inedible

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

51.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H891.def: = undesirable plant product, probably bad-smelling and inedible

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H4881.def: = a hedge of thorns, thistles, briers; ≈ regarded as an obstacle

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H1447.def: = a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H4823.def: = action by which humans or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1326.def: = state in which an object has suffered extensive damage to the extent that it cannot be used again

H2168.def: = action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H7898.def: = small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

H8068.def: = a legendary rock or mineral, known for its hardness; ≈ associated with an inflexible mind

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H4305.def: = causative action by which a deity causes water to come down from the sky

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H5194.def: = vegetation, ◄ intentionally sown or planted by humans

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H4939.def: meaning unknown; possibly: = state in which part of people's bodies is covered with crusts, possibly suggesting that they had been cut or wounded; ≈ associated with humiliation

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

81.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H8047.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6776.def: = a pair of animals, ◄ such as donkeys or oxen, ► tied or yoked together for a common task, plowing or transportation of goods

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H1324.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H374.def: = a unit of dry measure of which the exact quantity is unknown and ranges between 20 and 40 liters; one ephah equals 10 {L:omer<SDBH:עֹמֶר>}

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H309.def: = process by which an event happens later than expected

H5399.def: = the time of day before the sun comes up and after the sun goes down

H1814.def: = process by which an object is affected or consumed by fire

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H4960.def: = action by which humans consume water or other liquids

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H5035.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

H8596.def: = musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

H2485.def: = a high-pitched wind instrument consisting of a tube with holes along it, ◄ usually made of wood

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H6704.def: = process by which humans become weak ◄ as a result of a lack of water

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6942.def: = action by which humans that are part of a {L:holy<SDBH:קָדֹושׁ>} nation set themselves apart from others by not engaging in activities that are not in accordance with God's law

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3532.def: = young of a sheep, either male or female; ► eaten at Passover, and used for sacrifice; its fleece is used for clothing

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H4220.def: = a young animal that is fattened for slaughter

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H5699.def: = two or four-wheeled carriage or cart, used for travel or the transport of loads; pulled by draft animals, such as {L:oxen<SDBH:שֹׁור>}, {L:donkeys<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}, or {L:horses<SDBH:סוּס>}

H5688.def: = piece of cord or chain; ◄ made by twisting together strands of palm fibres, linen, reeds, or gold; ► used for tying and keeping things together

4.gl: to draw along > to engage in

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H4966.def: = state in which food tastes well

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H4537.def: = action by which humans mix different ingredients into a single substance

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7810.def: = an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H2842.def: meaning unsure; either: (1) = dried grass or leaves; ► useless, ≈ and considered of little value; or: (2) = the husks of grain or other seed, separated by winnowing or threshing; ► useless, ≈ and considered of little value

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H80.def: = finely powdered substance, laying on the ground or on other objects or carried about by the wind; ◄ consisting of earth, soot, or other material; ≈ often associated with conditions that are transitory and do not endure

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H565.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

40.gl: to go up like dust > to disappear

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2734.def: = process by which humans gradually disappear from the face of the earth ◄ as if burnt away by fire

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H5038.def: = the dead body of humans or animals

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5251.def: = a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4120.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H7031.def: = state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H5123.def: = state in which humans or animals are in a state of a relatively light sleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive

H3462.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

H232.def: = piece of cloth ► wrapped around the waist to cover the private parts; commonly worn by slaves; ≈ associated with low status

H2504.def: = area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip-bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H5275.def: = a covering for the foot ◄ usually made of leather or wood ► either  open and laced around the foot or ankle with a strap, or closed around the foot like a shoe

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H1534.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H7581.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion

H7580.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H5098.def: = action by which an animal makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5098.def: = action by which an animal makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

H5100.def: = process by which an inanimate object makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment
